alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 8:24PM EDT until April 24 at 2:24AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Barclay Messerly Road, McConnell East, and Knowlton Roads will be flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 10.7 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall late tomorrow morning. It will rise to 10.7 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on 03/13/1939. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 630 AM EDT.
